question.content:
**Find the area, in square units, of $\triangle ABC$ plotted below.**



[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate plane. Triangle A B C has point A at zero, seven, point B at seven, negative two, and point C at negative three, negative four. There is a slanted dashed line connecting from point A to a point D on side B C at a ninety degree angle at two, negative three.

hints.content:
###The strategy

$\text{Area of a triangle} = \dfrac{1}{2}\cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}$

Before we can apply the formula to find the area of $\triangle ABC$, we must find the base and height of the triangle using the Pythagorean theorem (or the distance formula).

* The base is the length $BC$.
* The height is the length $AD$ (the base and the height always meet at a right angle).

###Step 1: Find the length $BC$



[[☃ image 1]]

$\begin{align} 
BC^2&= {\redE{10}^2 +\redE{2}^2 }  &&\text{Pythagorean theorem} \\\\
BC&= \sqrt{\redE{10}^2 +\redE{2}^2 }  &&\text{Square root both sides}\\\\
&=\sqrt{104} \\\\
&=\sqrt{4\cdot26} \\\\
&=\tealE{2\sqrt{26}}
\end{align}$

options.alt: A coordinate plane. Triangle A B C has point A at zero, seven, point B at seven, negative two, and point C at negative three, negative four. There is a slanted dashed line connecting from point A to a point D on side B C at a ninety degree angle at two, negative three. A highlighted horizontal line of ten units connects point C to a vertical highlighted line of two units to point B.

hints.content:
###Step 2: Find the length $AD$



[[☃ image 1]]

$\begin{align} 
AD^2&= {\redE{10}^2 +\redE{2}^2 }  &&\text{Pythagorean theorem} \\\\
AD&= \sqrt{\redE{10}^2 +\redE{2}^2 }  &&\text{Square root both sides}\\\\
&=\sqrt{104} \\\\
&=\sqrt{4\cdot26} \\\\
&=\goldE{2\sqrt{26}}
\end{align}$

options.alt: A coordinate plane. Triangle A B C has point A at zero, seven, point B at seven, negative two, and point C at negative three, negative four. There is a slanted dashed line connecting from point A to a point D on side B C at a ninety degree angle at two, negative three. A highlighted horizontal line of two units connects point A to a vertical highlighted line of ten units to point D.

hints.content:
###Step 3: Find the area of the triangle

Using the base and height of $\triangle ABC$, we can find the area:

$\begin{align} \text{Area of a triangle} &= \dfrac{1}{2}\cdot \text{base} \cdot \text{height}\\\\
&= \dfrac{1}{2}\cdot BC\cdot AD \\\\
&= \dfrac{1}{2}\cdot(\tealE{2\sqrt{26}})\cdot(\goldE{2\sqrt{26}}) \\\\
&= 2\cdot \sqrt{26}\cdot\sqrt{26} \\\\
&= 2 \cdot 26 \\\\
&= 52
\end{align}$

###The answer:

The area of $\triangle ABC$ is $52$ units$^2$.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.showPrompt: Could we find the area another way?
options.explanation:
Yes, we can find the area of the outer rectangle, then subtract the areas of the triangular regions outside of $\triangle ABC$.


[[☃ image 1]]

$\begin{align}
\text{Area}_{\triangle ABC} &= 10(11) - \text{Area}_{\triangle1} - \text{Area}_{\triangle2} - \text{Area}_{\triangle3} \\\\
&=110 - \dfrac{1}{2}(7)(9)-\dfrac{1}{2}(10)(2)-\dfrac{1}{2}(3)(11)\\\\
&=110-31.5-10-16.5\\\\
&=52
\end{align}$

The area of $\triangle ABC$ is $52$ units$^2$.

options.alt: A coordinate plane. Triangle A B C has point A at zero, seven, point B at seven, negative two, and point C at negative three, negative four. Triangle A B C is inscribed in a rectangle that has a point at negative three, seven, a point at seven, seven, a point at seven, negative three, and a point at negative three, negative four. This creates three triangles that are cut out of the larger rectangle by triangle A B C. The top left triangle is triangle three. The top right triangle is triangle one. The bottom right triangle is triangle two.
